channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Communities are drawing on the power of cooking to stay connected as isolation leaves many hungry for company.
item.title: Home cooking warms hearts during lonely days of lockdown

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: At first glance the official earnings data appears to be the first bit of good news economists have seen for months, but statistics are yet another victim of the pandemic.
item.title: 'Dude, where's my pay rise?': Wage figures not quite what they seem

item.description: "The oxygen is getting thin, and we are all choking but ... keep resisting and keep fighting for our rule of law and freedom," the bailed media tycoon said.
item.title: 'Persist': Jimmy Lai says HK needs patient democracy campaign

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: Mounting evidence suggests the vast majority of coronavirus cases may be spread by as little as 10 per cent of those infected..
item.title: Super-spreaders could be key to controlling COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: NSW Tourism Minister Stuart Ayres has endorsed a federal warning that states must be financially responsible for their domestic tourism sectors if they keep borders closed longer than necessary.
item.title: NSW backs federal tourism warning over border closures

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: Australia has a new musical superstar, and he’s a 16-year-old rapper from Waterloo’s housing flats named The Kid Laroi.
item.title: The Kid Laroi, the pride of Waterloo, takes on the world

item.description: Paul George scored 27 points and Kawhi Leonard added 26, and the Los Angeles Clippers defeated the Denver Nuggets 124-111 on Thursday (AEST).
item.title: NBA round-up: Clippers lock up No.2 seed with win

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: A noted Geelong collector outbid three Australian museums to secure 23 items of Graham 'Polly' Farmer memorabilia from the AFL legend's collection, including the 1960 Sandover Medal for $15,000.
item.title: Geelong collector spends big on 'Polly' memorabilia

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: Premier's Solomon Lew has been able to game the government support package beautifully, and legally.
item.title: Sollykeeper: Billionaire Lew gives retailers a lesson on how to win during COVID

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: The decision is the second win by the government against protesters in the past week, but narrowed what would have been a much broader scope initially sought.
item.title: Supreme Court grants injunction against weekend refugee protest

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Premier Investments says it is on track to book a record full-year profit on the back of strong online sales and tens of millions of dollars in JobKeeper subsidies.
item.title: Solomon Lew's Premier to post record profit thanks to JobKeeper, online sales

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queensland politicians will have their salaries frozen for four years as almost a quarter of a million people are out of work across the state.
item.title: Pay freeze for MPs with 234,800 Queenslanders out of work

item.description: Follow the live action as the Swans meet the Giants in Perth from 8.10pm AEST.
item.title: Live AFL scores: Sydney Swans v GWS Giants

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: The gutting of Victoria’s universities continues, with La Trobe opening up a second round of redundancies and Victoria University revealing a plan to cut up to 190 jobs.
item.title: Hundreds more university jobs to go as La Trobe, Vic Uni announce cuts

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: The Dragons' lack of urgency when it came to moving on their under-performing coach cost them a crack at highly rated young mentors like Jason Ryles and Craig Fitzgibbon.
item.title: McGregor's sacking the right decision... about a year too late

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: In this episode, senior culture writer Nathanael Cooper is joined by media and telecommunications journalist Zoe Samios to discuss the future of local streaming services like Stan and Binge as global media giants begin to establish their own services.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: will global giants squash Australia's streaming platforms?

item.dc:creator: Martin Boulton
item.description: The Australian musician said a refusal to engage with uncomfortable ideas has "an asphyxiating effect on the creative soul of a society".
item.title: Nick Cave slams cancel culture as 'bad religion run amuck'

item.description: Now is our opportunity to learn more about how the virus moves through our communities and how to chart a safe path ahead.
item.title: Stage four lockdown offers a chance to find our path out

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: A Bushfire relief match featuring Didier Drogba, Claudio Marchisio and Dwight Yorke has been scrapped due to the global pandemic.
item.title: Football For Fires charity match cancelled due to COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: The Melbourne Rebels have top spot on the Super Rugby AU ladder in their sights but they face Queensland Reds in Brisbane on Saturday.
item.title: Young Rebels aim for top spot but Reds shape as big challenge

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Gai Waterhouse has a very strong spring team and thinks she has a couple of winners at Randwick on Saturday.
item.title: Waterhouse focuses on the Up And Coming instead of trials

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The victim is a family-owned civil construction company in Logan and the money was allegedly taken from 2007-2017.
item.title: Queensland man charged with defrauding $10 million from his employer

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: The state government will spend nearly $53 million in a "state-of-the-art" police station in the heart of Fremantle, nearly a decade after asbestos fears pushed officers out of the original station.
item.title: Government pledges more than $50 million towards new Freo police station

item.description: In 2015, the year Trump began his campaign for president, Harris said she gave his donations to charity.
item.title: Trump donated money to Kamala Harris' campaigns twice

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: If the Waratahs win a game by seven points or more, history shows they're very likely to lose the next.
item.title: The alarming statistics showing the Waratahs can't back up big wins

item.description: Mitchell Starc remains wary of injuries from bowling too fast but the Australia paceman hopes to push the 160km/h mark in the coming home summer after adding five kilograms to his frame during a long off-season.
item.title: Starc adds muscle in effort to get speed gun up

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Francesco De Ferrari refused to answer questions on whether the wealth giant has a culture that discriminates against women.
item.title: AMP chief tight-lipped on executive departure

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The number of people waiting for elective surgery has been greatly reduced and hospitals saw people quickly in emergency departments, the figures show.
item.title: Queensland hospital wait times improved, despite pandemic disruption

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: Lawyers for a Porsche driver who allegedly filmed and taunted a dying police officer on a Melbourne freeway are fighting to have a key charge thrown out.
item.title: Porsche driver Richard Pusey fighting charge as plea negotiations stall

item.description: Forest fires are up 17 per cent in the first 10 days of August, compared with the same period a year ago, according to official government data.
item.title: Bolsonaro calls 10,000 new Amazon fires this month a 'lie'

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: AMP has finally recognised it has cultural problems. The wealth giant will need to show solid progress on tackling them to protect its stability, its market value and its independence.
item.title: Jolted into the 21st century, AMP faces its cultural awakening

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: A viral text message which saw Clayton Douglas' first runner plunged from $6 into a $1.70 favourite might have been fictional, but the horse lived up to the hype.
item.title: Horse at centre of viral text wins like Winx

item.description: Hunt 'cautiously optimistic' about second wave; Sydney cluster grows to 20; Queensland police charge man after alleged hotel quarantine escape. News updates here.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: There have been warnings vulnerable students would be most at risk from a policy to revoke access to government funding for failing too many subjects.
item.title: 'Punishment': Backlash over funding changes for failing uni students

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: The Socceroos are set to play as many as 14 qualifiers in 12 months, leaving A-League clubs without players at crucial points of the season.
item.title: Corica, Grant call for international breaks after World Cup qualifiers pushed back

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Australia's largest miner is facing a landmark shareholder push to put a moratorium on all activities that threaten significant Aboriginal sites.
item.title: Indigenous leaders, investors urge BHP to halt works at sacred sites

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Nakia Cockatoo will return and play senior football this season but the Cats say that won't be in their next two matches.
item.title: Cats ease expectations of imminent Cockatoo return

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Victoria has recorded 278 new coronavirus cases in the past day, marking a significant decline in daily infections, but concerns are increasing about 'mystery cases' emerging outside Melbourne.
item.title: 'Concerning': Regional testing push after rise in 'mystery cases'

item.description: Ron Tauranac took two years to build his first racing car in a lock-up garage in Sydney. The first time he raced it, in 1950, the car ran wide in a corner, flipped and threw him out. He nearly died.
item.title: Partnered Brabham to F1 world titles

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: The chances of an elderly resident contracting COVID-19 in an aged care home decreases substantially for every registered nurse employed, with even an additional 20 minutes a day per resident cutting deaths and cases by more than 20 per cent.
item.title: Hiring more nurses could slow the spread of COVID-19 in nursing homes

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bunbury
item.description: Melbourne International Film Festival review: The Metamorphosis of Birds.
item.title: Bring your own poetry to this saga of familial love

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: A Sydney judge has ruled a Redfern terrace owner acquired ownership of a valuable patch of land thanks to squatter's rights.
item.title: Redfern terrace owners fight over ownership of 'dunny lane'

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: Two men suspected of being members of a crime syndicate have lost a bid to stay in Victoria after being charged with attempting to import half a tonne of cocaine via Queensland.
item.title: Bail bid rejected for alleged members of Melbourne cocaine syndicate

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: The inquiry into the Victorian government's response to the coronavirus pandemic has shed light on how the state's transport authorities are preparing for the return of commuters when restrictions start to ease.
item.title: New bike lanes among changes planned for post-COVID Melbourne commuters

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A bill introduced to Parliament on Thursday will ban media from publishing details of corruption complaints made against political candidates during caretaker period.
item.title: Complaints to state's corruption watchdog to be kept secret before elections

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Clive Palmer is not mincing words: "The act is more akin to the laws of China than Australia."
item.title: 'The Castle' principle at stake as Palmer Law set to sail through Parliament

item.dc:creator: Henrietta Cook
item.description: The number of active coronavirus cases in Victoria fell for the first time in two months, and NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian has warned of harsher restrictions if she doesn't see more people in masks.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 278 COVID-19 cases, 8 deaths; NSW has 12 new cases; New Zealand cluster grows to 13

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk said 7.7 million hectares of land was razed across Queensland during last year's bushfire season.
item.title: Binna Burra to reopen for visitors one year after fire devastation

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Listed industrial property juggernaut Goodman has defied the global pandemic by delivering an above-guidance profit.
item.title: Goodman defies pandemic with $1b profit as e-commerce demand builds

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Tommy Berry wants group 1 wins, like every jockey, but his desire to win the Sydney premiership is greater.
item.title: 'It's hard not to be excited': Berry's spring stars return
